item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Truth is stranger than fiction, but it is because Fiction is obliged to stick to possibilities; Truth isn't." -- Mark Twain

item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Men occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of them pick themselves up and hurry off as if nothing ever happened." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "The reason I talk to myself is because I’m the only one whose answers I accept." -- George Carlin

item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by Niels Bohr
item.description: "The opposite of a correct statement is a false statement. But the opposite of a profound truth may well be another profound truth." -- Niels Bohr

item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is my belief... that the truth is generally preferable to lies." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Love truth, but pardon error." -- Voltaire

item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "I'm for truth, no matter who tells it. I'm for justice, no matter who it is for or against. I'm a human being, first and foremost, and as such I'm for whoever and whatever benefits humanity as a whole." -- Malcolm X

item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by Jessamyn West
item.description: "Fiction reveals truth that reality obscures." -- Jessamyn West

item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "If you look for truth, you may find comfort in the end; if you look for comfort you will not get either comfort or truth only soft soap and wishful thinking to begin, and in the end, despair." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Truth never damages a cause that is just." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There's a world of difference between truth and facts. Facts can obscure truth." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "When you are sorrowful look again in your heart, and you shall see that in truth you are weeping for that which has been your delight." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by François de La Rochefoucauld
item.description: "No persons are more frequently wrong, than those who will not admit they are wrong." -- François de La Rochefoucauld

item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by Niels Bohr
item.description: "Prediction is very difficult, especially about the future." -- Niels Bohr

item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "People think that a liar gains a victory over his victim. What I’ve learned is that a lie is an act of self-abdication, because one surrenders one’s reality to the person to whom one lies, making that person one’s master, condemning oneself from then on to faking the sort of reality that person’s view requires to be faked…The man who lies to the world, is the world’s slave from then on…There are no white lies, there is only the blackest of destruction, and a white lie is the blackest of all." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has." -- Margaret Mead

item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "If the world were merely seductive, that would be easy. If it were merely challenging, that would be no problem. But I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E.B. White

item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world." -- Anne Frank

item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "You cannot find peace by avoiding life." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Life is an opportunity, benefit from it. Life is beauty, admire it. Life is a dream, realize it. Life is a challenge, meet it. Life is a duty, complete it. Life is a game, play it. Life is a promise, fulfill it. Life is sorrow, overcome it. Life is a song, sing it. Life is a struggle, accept it. Life is a tragedy, confront it. Life is an adventure, dare it. Life is luck, make it. Life is too precious, do not destroy it. Life is life, fight for it." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Everything you can imagine is real." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by Arundhati Roy
item.description: "To love. To be loved. To never forget your own insignificance. To never get used to the unspeakable violence and the vulgar disparity of life around you. To seek joy in the saddest places. To pursue beauty to its lair. To never simplify what is complicated or complicate what is simple. To respect strength, never power. Above all, to watch. To try and understand. To never look away. And never, never to forget." -- Arundhati Roy

item.title: The Wicked Witch add a quote by Gilda Radner
item.description: "I wanted a perfect ending. Now I've learned, the hard way, that some poems don't rhyme, and some stories don't have a clear beginning, middle, and end. Life is about not knowing, having to change, taking the moment and making the best of it, without knowing what's going to happen next. Delicious Ambiguity." -- Gilda Radner
